intro: Hieracium dispalatum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Hieracium dispalatum is often found in open habitats and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
